div.span: Tiger Music performing at Prairie Sunset Village

div.div: The primary function of the Mobridge-Pollock Public School System is to promote the well-rounded and continuous growth of its youth into effective citizens in a democratic society. To attain this goal the school shall endeavor to provide a suitable environment for helpful guidance, training, and experiences which will assist each student to become better adjusted in his/her family, social, and business relationships, concerned for his/her own welfare and the welfare of others, open-minded on controversial issues, trained in work habits, skills, and logical reasoning, and prepared for profitable and gratifying use of leisure time. Furthermore, the school shall endeavor to provide for the physical and moral well-being of each student. Finally, the school shall cooperate with the home, church, and other community forces to build the educative experience of its youth.
Mobridge-Pollock Schools will be supporting "Let It Shine South Dakota" on May 1st.
Working together parents, community members, students, and educators can make a difference. Let's continue to learn while demonstrating social responsibility in our community.

article.aria-label: Dr. Seuss Theme Night: Parents Night Out

h3.a: Dr. Seuss Theme Night: Parents Night Out

div.div: National Honor Society hosting a K-5 fun night on February 28th from 6:00-9:00 pm in the High School Commons.
The MP School District will makeup the snow day we had yesterday (February 12th) on March 19th as per the approved school calendar.
Mobridge Regional Hospital has offered a public announcement in supporting the community in answering questions you may have on the recent case of pertussis in the community.

article.aria-label: Basketball Doubleheader on Saturday, December 28th - Postponed

h3.a: Basketball Doubleheader on Saturday, December 28th - Postponed

div.div: The basketball doubleheader versus Ellendale-Edgeley has been postponed for Saturday, December 28th.

The South Dakota Music Education Association recognizes teachers serving 25 or more years to music education. Mrs. Zahn received her 25-year award prior to the All-State concert. Pictured with Mrs. Zahn is Kim Bogart, SDMEA award chair.
Congratulations to Reese Cerney and Kregen Norder for being named to the All-State Football Team. Congratulations to Caden Halsey and Trace Cerney for being named Honorable Mention All-State.

Congratulations to Heidi Olson, Caelen McCollam, and Blaise Thompson on qualifying for the State. Heidi placed 3rd, Caelen placed 12th, and Blaise placed 5th at the region meet in Chamberlain on Thursday. Good luck at State next week.
